title: When did Fall Out Boy become sellouts? - Quora

response.answer_text: Never, really. A sellout implies a massive shift from their artistic roots just for the sake of gaining followers, and while their sound has changed, it’s done so in a rather smooth manner. While they had an emo pop influence in the early days, they were fundamentally a pop punk band. They just went poppier as time went on, which is hardly unheard of for bands of the genre. While you can argue that they struck gold when they got MTV success and latched on to commercial success, there really is no period where you can point and say “FOB abandoned their original spirit just to chase a trend”.

they didn’t? just because they don’t sound the same as they did ten, fifteen years ago or even as the last album, doesn’t mean they sold out that would be really boring and to be honest i don’t see why you would want to restrict soemone’s creative development so you can have more of the same style song-people grow and change and when that happens so will their music
